page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content: In our area there are about 1000 mm of rain per annum. About 180 days of the year are rainy and the average number of mornings with snow is between 10 and 15 days. There are about 5 hours of bright sunshine a day on average. Here, as in most country areas, people are all for conservation. Something like 1000 trees were planted by a local farmer because so many Elms were killed by the Dutch Elm disease ten years ago. Rather than planting whole fields of trees, the new trees are being planted in hedges and other places where crops can not be grown. There are not many factories around us so there is not too much pollution.
